item.title: 德意志银行在皮博迪煤炭贷款融资方中脱颖而出
item.description: 当皮博迪能源公司（Peabody Energy Corp. ）同意收购英美资源集团（Anglo American Plc）的煤炭资产时，只有一家欧洲贷款机构加入了美国投资银行家和私人信贷专家的行列，为这笔交易提供资金：德意志银行（Deutsche Bank AG）。【原文：When Peabody Energy Corp. agreed to buy the coal assets of Anglo American Plc, only one European lender joined the US investment bankers and private credit specialists financing the deal: Deutsche Bank AG.】

item.title: 巴巴多斯完成 1.25 亿美元债务转换以增强气候适应能力
item.description: 巴巴多斯成功完成了一项债务转换，旨在产生 1.25 亿美元的节余，用于使其供水和污水处理系统更能适应气候变化。【原文：Barbados has successfully completed a debt swap designed to generate $125 million in savings that it can use to make its water and sewage systems more resilient to climate change.】

item.title: 纽约和美国东部的北极寒流终于要结束了
item.description: 一股寒流在美国五大湖区引发了一场大规模的湖泊效应暴风雪，并使纽约市笼罩在零度以下的低温中，到本周末，这股寒流将终于开始对该地区失去控制。【原文：A frigid blast that triggered a massive lake-effect snow storm across the US Great Lakes and blanketed New York City with sub-freezing temperatures will finally start to lose its grip on the region by this weekend.】

item.title: 拜登出价 75 亿美元收购三星 SDI-Stellantis 电池中心
item.description: 三星 SDI 有限公司和 Stellantis NV 的合资企业将在印第安纳州建立电池生产厂，拜登政府将为该企业提供 75.4 亿美元的融资。Ltd 和 Stellantis NV 成立的合资企业将在印第安纳州建立电池生产厂，拜登政府将为该企业提供 75.4 亿美元的融资。【原文：A joint venture between Samsung SDI Co. item.title: 欧盟新领导层将于下月概述竞争力计划
item.description: 欧盟执行机构计划于下月提交一份计划大纲，说明在推行雄心勃勃的清洁技术改革的同时，如何提高欧盟与美国和中国的竞争力。【原文：The European Union’s executive arm plans to present next month the outlines of a plan for how to boost the bloc’s competitiveness with the US and China as it pursues an ambitious clean-tech overhaul.】

item.title: Globeleq 的莫桑比克天然气发电厂因极端天气而推迟开工
item.description: Globeleq 公司在莫桑比克的天然气发电站旨在为世界上最贫穷的国家之一增加电力供应，但由于极端天气事件，该项目已推迟数月至 2025 年。【原文：Globeleq Inc.’s gas-fired power station in Mozambique, designed to boost electricity in one of the world’s poorest nations, has been delayed for several months into 2025 due to extreme weather events.】

item.title: 泰国洪灾死亡人数增至 22 人，预报将有更多降雨
item.description: 泰国南部遭受了几十年来最严重的洪灾，死亡人数上升到 22 人，数千人仍被困在救灾营地，当局警告说未来几天还会有更大的降雨。【原文：The death toll from the worst flooding to hit southern Thailand in decades rose to 22 as several thousand people remained confined to relief camps, and authorities warned of more heavy rain over the next few days.】

item.title: 澳大利亚电网寻求电力供应，以遏制世界太阳能热潮
item.description: 澳大利亚的主要电网正在寻求权力，以限制全国无处不在的屋顶太阳能电池板所提供的电力。【原文：Australia’s main grid is seeking powers to curb the amount of electricity supplied by the nation’s ubiquitous rooftop solar panels.】

item.title: 中西部的北极寒流和大雪影响节后出行
item.description: 据美国天气预报中心称，未来两天，北极地区的严寒和降雪将在五大湖区造成危险状况，可能会打乱数百万人的出行计划。【原文：An arctic blast of severe cold and snow is creating hazardous conditions across the Great Lakes region over the next two days, according to the US Weather Prediction Center, potentially disrupting the plans of millions traveling the roads and skies.】

item.description: 经过两年的分歧谈判，约 200 个国家未能就遏制塑料污染的条约达成一致，但他们表示取得了一些进展，并将于明年再次举行会谈。【原文：About 200 nations couldn’t agree on a treaty to curb plastic pollution after two years of divisive negotiations, but said they made some progress and would reconvene the talks next year.】

item.title: 周末假日旅游期间美国部分地区被暴风雪覆盖
item.description: 纽约州布法罗（美联社）— 在美国假日旅游和购物的繁忙周末，纽约州、宾夕法尼亚州和密歇根州的部分地区迎来了本季第一场大雪，预计刺骨的寒冷和大雪将持续到本周早些时候，并给五大湖、平原和中西部地区带来危险。【原文：BUFFALO, N.Y. (AP) — The first big snowfall of the season blanketed parts of New York, Pennsylvania and Michigan during the hectic U.S. holiday travel and shopping weekend, with numbing cold and heavy snow forecast to persist through the early part of the week and cause hazards in the Great Lakes, Plains and Midwest regions.】

item.title: 泰国南部几十年来最严重洪灾造成至少 12 人死亡
item.description: 据一家政府机构称，泰国南部几十年来最严重的洪灾已造成至少 12 人死亡，60 多万户家庭受灾。【原文：At least 12 people have died and more than 600,000 households have been affected by the worst flooding in southern Thailand in decades, according to a government agency.】

item.title: 中西部严寒和降雪威胁感恩节后出行
item.description: 五大湖区的部分地区被近 3 英尺（90 厘米）的积雪淹没，预计这将是美国有史以来最繁忙的周末旅行之一，因为美国人将从感恩节假期的聚会中返回家中。【原文：Parts of the Great Lakes region were pummeled with almost 3 feet (90 centimeters) of snow, threatening what’s expected to be one of the busiest US travel weekends on record as Americans return home from Thanksgiving holiday gatherings.】

item.title: 约翰内斯堡因供水不足而考虑加强用水限制
item.description: 南非的商业之都正在考虑采取更严格的限水措施，因为它既要维护老化的基础设施，又要应对日益增长的需求。【原文：South Africa’s business capital is considering tighter water curbs as it battles to maintain aging infrastructure and cope with increased demand.】

item.title: 德里空气污染严重，印度仍削减汽车廉价汽油供应
item.description: 印度正在削减廉价车用天然气的供应，因为印度正努力应对国内生产短缺的问题，此举可能会加剧包括新德里在内的大城市的有毒空气问题。【原文：India is cutting back its supply of cheap gas for vehicles as it struggles to cope with domestic production shortages, a move that could add to toxic air woes in major cities including New Delhi.】

item.title: 气候专家敦促日本制定更宏伟的减排目标
item.description: 继日本政府官员周一提出建议后，一批气候科学家、学者和活动家敦促日本制定雄心勃勃的 2035 年碳减排目标。【原文：A group of climate scientists, academics and activists urged Japan to set an ambitious 2035 carbon reduction target, following a proposal made by government officials on Monday.】

Meat-centric diets are significantly contributing to global emissions. Yet new data show that some techniques to promote more sustainable eating are working.

item.title: 东南亚暴雨淹没农场并迫使人们撤离
item.description: 东南亚部分地区的暴雨和山洪阻碍了棕榈和橡胶种植园的工作，中断了电力供应，并迫使数千人撤离。【原文：Heavy rains and flash floods in parts of Southeast Asia have hampered work at palm and rubber plantations, interrupted power supply and forced the evacuation of thousands of people.】

item.title: 夏季来临，澳大利亚野火风险升高

item.title: 中国电动汽车热潮有可能将汽油需求推下悬崖
item.description: 从环绕北京故宫的古巷中的特斯拉充电桩，到西部沙漠中设有充电桩的孤独的高速公路休息站，中国交通运输电气化和汽油消亡的迹象随处可见。【原文：From Tesla chargers in the ancient alleys that surround the Forbidden City in Beijing to lonely highway rest stops with charging posts in the western deserts, signs of the electrification of China’s transport fleet — and the demise of gasoline — are everywhere.】
